identity.name: Palantir Technologies
identity.corporate_structure: Delaware Corporation, Dual-Class Share Structure (Class F control)

v23_knowledge_graph.investment_thesis: Palantir has evolved from a niche defense contractor into the operating system for the modern AI-enabled enterprise. The 'Bootcamp' GTM strategy has significantly compressed sales cycles, driving US Commercial revenue growth >40%. Inclusion in the S&P 500 validates institutional grade, while AIP (Artificial Intelligence Platform) provides the critical 'logic layer' missing in generative AI deployments, allowing enterprises to move from chat-bots to autonomous agents.

strategic_pillars.name: Gotham
strategic_pillars.key_metric: Gov Revenue Growth 16% YoY; Contract Value TCV $1.3B+

strategic_pillars.name: Apollo
strategic_pillars.key_metric: Deployments across 3 classifications (Unclassified, Secret, Top Secret)

ai_strategy.core_thesis: The 'Ontology' as the Context Window for Enterprise AI
ai_strategy.differentiation: While hyperscalers provide the compute and models (LLMs), Palantir provides the 'interoperability layer' that binds LLMs to structured enterprise data. This allows for 'Write-Back' capabilities—agents that can not only read data but execute actions (e.g., re-route supply chain, approve loan) within strict governance bounds.
ai_strategy.technological_moat: Dynamic Ontology, OGA (Ontology Growth Automations), and FedStart certification accreditation.

valuation.description: Trading at >85x forward P/E and >25x Sales. The stock is priced for hyper-growth; any miss in the 'Rule of 40' metric could trigger a severe correction.

geopolitical.description: While conflict drives Gotham demand, perception of 'controversial' government work (e.g., military, border control) can alienate commercial talent and ESG-focused investors.

execution.description: Bootcamp strategy is resource-intensive. Scaling the forward-deployed engineering (FDE) model without eroding margins remains a logistical challenge.

sections.title: The S&P 500 Catalyst
sections.content: Inclusion in the S&P 500 (Sept 2024) marked the transition from 'meme stock' to institutional staple. Passive inflows have stabilized the shareholder base, reducing volatility relative to beta. This creates a floor for the stock price, allowing management to focus on long-term R&D without quarter-to-quarter panic.

sections.title: AIP: Beyond the Hype
sections.content: Most enterprise AI is 'Chat-with-your-PDF'. Palantir's AIP is 'Chat-to-Execute'. By binding LLMs to the Foundry Ontology, Palantir solves the 'Hallucination Problem' (grounding answers in data) and the 'Actuation Problem' (allowing AI to safely modify systems). The 'Bootcamp' sales motion—getting customers from zero to use-case in 5 days—has disrupted the traditional 6-month enterprise sales cycle.

sections.title: Financial Resilience
sections.content: Palantir is a 'Fortress Balance Sheet' company. With zero debt and ~$4B in cash, it is earning significant interest income ($100M+/yr) which flows directly to the bottom line, supporting GAAP profitability. This financial health allows them to aggressively hire top-tier AI talent while competitors cut costs.
